Colours

Agriculture

Eerie Black #1F1E1F

Dim gray #66666E

Prussian Blue #023047

Air Force Blue #598392

Dark Spring Green #226F54

Pistachio #87C38F

Burnt Sienna #E76F51

Sandy Brown #F4A261

agriculture <- c("#1f1e1f", "#66666e", "#023047", "#598392", "#226f54", "#87c38f", "#e76f51", "#f4a261")

Agricultural Seasons

A subset of the colour blind 🎨👓 friendly palette from Bang Wong 2011, with predefined allocation to agriculture seasons. The colour associations are meant to be semi-logical (taken from typical seasonal colour associations) to enable more natural interpretation, without constant legend referencing.

Winter #0072B2

Early Spring #F0E442

Late Spring #009E73

Summer #56B4E9

Autumn #D55E00

ag_seasons <- c("#0072B2", "#F0E442", "#009E73", "#56B4E9", "#D55E00")

Halloween

Mantis #79C250

Purple Haze #52307D

Carrot Orange #FE8622

Sand #ECCC60

Thunder #2F2D2E

halloween <- c("#79C250", "#52307D", "#FE8622", "#ECCC60", "#2F2D2E")

Sequencing Companies

More to be used as a colour reference rather than a palette, as the contrast between some (i.e. Nanopore & MGI) is too low.

Illumina #79C250

Oxford Nanopore #2F2D2E

MGI #52307D

Element Biosciences #FE8622

Singular Genomics #ECCC60

seq_companies <- c("#F9A31E", "#0083A9", "#006AB7", "#0A7537", "#1E1E1E")

Windows Desktops

95 Green #79C250

95 Grey #2F2D2E

ME Blue #52307D

ME Grey #FE8622

XP Blue #ECCC60

XP Green #ECCC60

win_desktops <- c('#008080', '#C0C0C0', '#3A6EA5', '#D4D0C8', '#255FDC', '#48AF48')
